source_sentence: Pasūro paribbājako hīnapañño nihīnapañño omakapañño lāmakapañño chatukkapañño parittapañño.
translation: Pahārāda, with little wisdom, low wisdom, terminator of wisdom, and travelers.

source_sentence: So hi bhagavā mahāpañño puthupañño hāsapañño javanapañño tikkhapañño nibbedhikapañño, paññāpabhedakusalo pabhinnañāṇo adhigatapaṭisambhido, catuvesārajjappatto dasabaladhārī, purisāsabho purisasīho purisanāgo purisājañño purisadhorayho, anantañāṇo anantatejo anantayaso aḍḍho mahaddhano dhanavā, netā vinetā anunetā, paññāpetā nijjhāpetā pekkhetā pasādetā.
translation: For that Blessed One with great wisdom, widespread wisdom, laughing wisdom, swift wisdom, sharp wisdom, and penetrating wisdom. He has achieved what is prosperous, with widespread of wisdom, resplendent, fearless, and veneration.

source_sentence: So hi bhagavā anuppannassa maggassa uppādetā, asañjātassa maggassa sañjanetā, anakkhātassa maggassa akkhātā, maggaññū maggavidū maggakovido maggānugā ca panassa etarahi sāvakā viharanti pacchā samannāgatā.
translation: For the Blessed One has arisen in the unarisen path, gave birth to the unborn path, explained the unexplained path. He was the knower of the path, the discoverer of the path, the expert on the path. And now he was fully explained the path.

source_sentence: So hi bhagavā jānaṁ jānāti passaṁ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto, vattā pavattā atthassa ninnetā amatassa dātā dhammassāmī tathāgato;
translation: For the Buddha knows and sees. He is vision, he is knowledge, he is the truth, he is holiness. He is the teacher, the proclaimer, the elucidator of meaning, the bestower of the deathless, the lord of truth, the Realized One.

source_sentence: natthi tassa bhagavato aññātaṁ adiṭṭhaṁ aviditaṁ asacchikataṁ aphassitaṁ paññāya.
translation: There is no such thing as knowing and seeing the Buddha has not known, seen, understood, realized, and experienced this with wisdom.

source_sentence: Atītaṁ anāgataṁ paccuppannaṁ upādāya sabbe dhammā sabbākārena buddhassa bhagavato ñāṇamukhe āpāthaṁ āgacchanti.
translation: In the past, future, and present are present. All of the Buddhas come from in front to truly.

source_sentence: Yaṁ kiñci neyyaṁ nāma atthi dhammaṁ jānitabbaṁ.

source_sentence: evamevaṁ buddhassa bhagavato neyyañca ñāṇañca aññamaññapariyantaṭṭhāyino;

source_sentence: yāvatakaṁ neyyaṁ tāvatakaṁ ñāṇaṁ, yāvatakaṁ ñāṇaṁ tāvatakaṁ neyyaṁ, neyyapariyantikaṁ ñāṇaṁ, ñāṇapariyantikaṁ neyyaṁ, neyyaṁ atikkamitvā ñāṇaṁ nappavattati, ñāṇaṁ atikkamitvā neyyapatho natthi.
translation: each time just as far as the size of life lasts. They know: “Whoever has a limited knowledge has been overturned, but only knowledge which has been passed by, not overestimation, and who knows how to cross the over the overcoming at indeed.

source_sentence: Aññamaññapariyantaṭṭhāyino te dhammā sabbadhammesu buddhassa bhagavato ñāṇaṁ pavattati.
translation: Mutinally, the limited is knowledge about the Buddhas’ Dhamma, and set flows down to all things.

source_sentence: Sabbe dhammā buddhassa bhagavato āvajjanapaṭibaddhā ākaṅkhapaṭibaddhā manasikārapaṭibaddhā cittuppādapaṭibaddhā.
translation: All things are clear in reference to the Buddha’s doctrines, applying to the dependent origination of the Buddha.

source_sentence: Sabbasattesu buddhassa bhagavato ñāṇaṁ pavattati, sabbesañca sattānaṁ bhagavā āsayaṁ jānāti anusayaṁ jānāti caritaṁ jānāti adhimuttiṁ jānāti.
translation: know all sentient beings in all.

source_sentence: Apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe tikkhindriye mudindriye svākāre dvākāre suviññāpaye duviññāpaye bhabbābhabbe satte pajānāti.
translation: having little dust on the eyes, having great dust on the eyes, having sharp faculties, having undeveloped faculties, with good qualities and easy to teach and hard to teach, hard to understand,

source_sentence: Sadevako loko samārako sabrahmako sassamaṇabrāhmaṇī pajā sadevamanussā antobuddhañāṇe parivattati.
translation: The world with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans, the Buddhas swells towards the Buddha.

source_sentence: Yathā ye keci macchakacchapā antamaso timitimiṅgalaṁ upādāya antomahāsamudde parivattanti;
translation: all the finger-snap ...

source_sentence: evamevaṁ sadevako loko samārako sabrahmako sassamaṇabrāhmaṇī pajā sadevamanussā antobuddhañāṇe parivattati.
translation: In the same way the world with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans,

source_sentence: Yathā ye keci pakkhī antamaso garuḷaṁ venateyyaṁ upādāya ākāsassa padese parivattanti;
translation: all the heavy burden is put down in the air, even as long as a bunch of space.

source_sentence: evamevaṁ yepi te sāriputtasamā paññāya tepi buddhañāṇassa padese parivattanti.
translation: In the same way, those who comprehend the Buddha’s knowledge even though the teaching and training proclaimed by the Buddha.

source_sentence: Buddhañāṇaṁ devamanussānaṁ paññaṁ pharitvā abhibhavitvā tiṭṭhati.
translation: Knowledge of the Buddha, Knowledge, (thinking):

source_sentence: Yepi te khattiyapaṇḍitā brāhmaṇapaṇḍitā gahapatipaṇḍitā samaṇapaṇḍitā nipuṇā kataparappavādā vālavedhirūpā Vobhindantā maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhigatāni, te pañhe abhisaṅkharitvā abhisaṅkharitvā tathāgate upasaṅkamitvā pucchanti gūḷhāni ca paṭicchannāni ca.
translation: Even those aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics who clever householders—they’ve already planned, planted out their doctrines—the answered with a question.

source_sentence: Kathitā visajjitāva te pañhā bhagavatā honti niddiṭṭhakāraṇā.
translation: those who are firmly established in the meaning have been admitted by the Buddha.
and they were unable to quench the Fortunate One’s words.

source_sentence: Atha kho bhagavāva tattha atirocati yadidaṁ paññāyāti—
translation: Rather, the Buddha spoke of wisdom there.

source_sentence: dhonena yugaṁ samāgamā, na hi tvaṁ sakkhasi sampayātave.
translation: Hurt out the pair of chief disciples who came together, not in the neighbourhood of a plough.
The Buddha replied,
“You should go to thoughts of thoughts,
to thought with the mind.
and being struck by a plough yoke.
for you can’t end the defilements.”
